notes: First-generation CTS on GM Sigma platform introduced Cadillac's 'Art and Science' design language. CTS-V performance variant offered with LS6/LS2 V8 engines and manual transmission. Data sourced from Wikipedia Cadillac CTS article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Second-generation CTS on GM Sigma II platform. 2000s portion only (2008-2009). Optional all-wheel drive introduced. Direct-injection V6 available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Cadillac CTS article, December 19, 2024 revision.

First-generation mid-size luxury crossover on GM Sigma platform (GMT265). Three-row, seven-passenger configuration. Longitudinally mounted front engine with rear differential. 2000s portion only (2004-2009). Data sourced from Wikipedia Cadillac SRX article, December 19, 2024 revision.

engines: 4.4L Northstar LC3 supercharged V8 (469 hp, STS-V)
notes: Mid-size luxury sedan on GM Sigma platform. First Cadillac sedan with all-wheel drive option (STS4 badge). STS-V features supercharged 4.4L Northstar V8 producing 469 hp. Optional Magnetic Ride Control suspension. Supercharged variant requires specialized service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Cadillac STS article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Full-size luxury sedan on GM G platform with transverse FWD layout. Replaced DeVille. Standard wheelbase (115.6 in) and long wheelbase DTS-L (123.6 in) variants available. Optional Magnetic Ride Control. Northstar V8 requires service attention for head gasket and coolant system issues. Data sourced from Wikipedia Cadillac DTS article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Luxury roadster on GM Y-body platform shared with Corvette C6. Rear-mounted transmission for near 50/50 weight distribution. Power retractable hardtop. XLR-V features supercharged 4.4L Northstar producing 443 hp. Magnetic Ride Control suspension. Built at Bowling Green Assembly Plant. Corvette-based platform and supercharged variant require specialized service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Cadillac XLR article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Full-size luxury SUV spanning second generation GMT800 (2002-2006) and third generation GMT900 (2007-2014, 2000s portion 2007-2009). Available in standard, ESV (extended), and EXT (sport utility truck) body styles. 2000s portion only. Escalade Hybrid introduced 2009 (different entry). Data sourced from Wikipedia Cadillac Escalade article, December 19, 2024 revision.
